intro: [WRONG START] Rubus × malacos, commonly known as the blackberry raspberry hybrid, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces aggregate fruits, which are typically dark red to black in color, and are edible when ripe. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and thickets. Due to its hybrid nature, it exhibits a range of morphological variations, making it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
